text: So I'm just learning some new stuff in C# & Python.
Turns out both lanuages support nested methods (C# sort of does).

code:
def MyMethod():

    print 'Hello from a method.'

    def MyInnerMethod():
        print 'Hello from a nested method.'

    MyInnerMethod()

static void Main()
{
    Console.WriteLine("Hello from main.");

    Func<int, int> NestedMethod =
        (x) =>
        {
            Console.WriteLine("In nested method. Value of x is {0}.", x);
            return x;
        };

    int result = NestedMethod(3);
}

text: So why are nested methods so important?
*The C# code has not been tested.
Feel free to edit if it doesn't compile.
